before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"d12fc","text":"I have begun including a double-stranded positive control oligo (dsCL104) in the library preparation; this is a double-stranded form of the single-stranded oligo described in Gansauge and Meyer (2013). Always include no-template controls and any extraction controls. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahsim","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dthf9","text":"Store PEG and ATP at -20 deg C and avoid repeated rounds of freeze thawing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lu8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fa7s0","text":"Store MyOne C1 Streptavidin beads at 4 deg C in a fridge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

34188.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9rkop","text":"Using an electronic balance, weigh out 2.2 g of agarose powder on to a weigh boat using a spatula.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"qai0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2bm6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6rda3","text":"Note that gel concentration can be adjusted. The more concentrated the gel, the greater the resolution of small fragment sizes. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"D18AF8C064B711EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bh1aa","text":"Transfer the powder to a 200 ml conical flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gfdq","text":"Using the graduated measurng cylinder, measure out 110 ml of 1xTAE buffer. Add to the conical flask containing the agarose powder. Swirl the flask gently to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jdt9","text":"Make up 2 L of 1X TAE buffer:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1lo5","text":"            ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"sf9r","text":"            50 ml of 40X TAE buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ok3j","text":"            1950 ml of MilliQ water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5t1v3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5sus0","text":"Mix by inversion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c4liq","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lpn7","text":"Microwave the flask uncovered for 1 minute. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b063b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"41na4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"frbfg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bok24","text":"A lid can loosly be placed over the flask but DO NOT tighten--allow steam to escape. Do not microwave for more than 1 minute at a time. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c8jpv","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dlfia","text":"Do not fill flasks or beakers/Schott bottles more than half full with liquid!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"D22D4BE064BA11EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86ach","text":"Remove the flask from the microwave using oven mitts and swirl gently.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dql1b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2ss2k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fec25","text":"The liquid is boiling! Use oven mitts to handle flask. Do not put your face over the opening to the flask as liquid can splash out!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"F2FA5C5064BA11EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tt","text":"Microwave the flask for a further minute but remove from the microwave if the agarose appears to boil excessively. Swirl to mix and examine near a light source to ensure the agarose has melted. Allow to cool for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3m6id","text":"Place the gel casting tray into a rubber vice that will seal the ends tightly, or tape the ends with masking tape. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd2bv","text":"Place the assembly on a flat bench and use the spirit level to check it is level--adjust if needed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aonsb","text":"Place a 20-well comb into the casting tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mama","text":"When the flask is cool to the touch, add 5 ul of SYBR Safe and swirl gently to mix. Avoid generating bubbles.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"98k4b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"17m8s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"af5m0","text":"Wait until the liquid is warm (not boiling) to cast the gel, or the tray may crack!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"15564A2064BB11EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7lut","text":"Pour the liquid gel slowly into the casting tray. Pop any bubbles that have formed using a clean pipette tip. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3c06v","text":"Let the gel set for 20-30 minutes at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ngdt","text":"Allow residual gel to set in the flask, then scrape into the bin. Fill the flask half full with water and microwave until the water boils. Pour the water down the sink and clean the flask using a bottle brush. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8dpcv","text":"When the gel is set, remove the combs gently.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1mocj","text":"Place the casting try and gel in the electrophoresis tank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1oat","text":"Fill the electrophoresis tank with 1 X TAE buffer to the fill line indicated on the tank. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqf3d","text":"Pipette 3 ul of 50 bp DNA ladder into the first well of the gel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9m946","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"erlug","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"devru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"etqlk","text":"The recommended volume will depend on the concentration of the ladder. Check the manufacterer's recommendations. If the ladder is not pre-mixed with loading dye, be sure to add 1-2 ul of loading dye before loading into the gel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"DCE9645064B611EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kvag","text":"Place some Parafilm across a 96-well PCR plate rack and press down firmly to create small wells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2e21u","text":"For each sample, pipette 1-2 ul of loading dye onto the Parafilm, taking care not to pierce the Parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jiuc","text":"Mix 10 ul of PCR product with the loading dye by pipetting gently up and down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5h1kq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7o86","text":"Transfer the 12 ul of PCR product/loading dye to the wells of the gel, taking care not to pierce the bottom of the well with the pipette tip. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"21ivd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7cgcn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bd76b","text":"The volume each well can take will depend on the size of the comb used. Be sure not to overload the wells or product will float out the top of the well.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"5CAA2A3064B711EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ouo4","text":"Place the lid on the gel tank and plug the electrodes into the appropriate power slots. Ensure the positive electrode is at the base of the gel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e4396","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c3s7q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"612ot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2ikd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fntn8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8ia0","text":"Take care when working with electricity and water! ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2cog1","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4m45u","text":"Check electrical cords of all equipment and ensure none are damaged and that cords are not a tripping hazard. Do not use if the electrical cord is damaged in any way. Tag the instrument with warnings, make the area safe, and notify your line manager and anyone else in the immediate area that may be affected. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ej40","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eopfa","text":"Use electrical equipment indoors only in an area free of explosive material, corrosive gas, powerful vibrations, direct exposure to sunlight, and temperature fluctuations. Use in a space where cables will not come into contact with liquids, be manually damaged, or interfere with other workplace operations. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"at05l","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dsb6c","text":"Do not use electrical equipment with any other power adapter or cord than the one supplied. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"9886E9C064B811EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43gse","text":"Switch the power pack on a set the voltage to 80 V and the time to 1 hr and 10 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bsjcm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"s7r7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"255hf","text":"Note that the voltage and time can be adjusted to suit what you are running on the gel. For amplicons (one small product), I will run the gel at 96 V for 30-40 min. For shotgun libraries, I will run the gel as above. The lower the voltage and longer it is run, the greater the separation of fragments will be. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"9AAAD0A064B711EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f01k","text":"Press 'Run' or 'Start' on the power pack and check to see that bubbles are rising from electrodes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lqm5","text":"When the run is over, switch of the power pack, remove the lid, and remove the gel from the tank, taking care not to let it slide off the tray. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"brp82","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"567g7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"r4n4","text":"Do not remove the lid to the electrophoresis tank until the power pack is switched off. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"2E856EE064BB11EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"apk3q","text":"Place the gel on the UV transilluminator and photograph using the attached camera. Follow the manufactuerer's instructions to use the equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6d40p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gcfl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ria9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4uvjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f4ev0","text":"Take care working with UV. You should have UV safety training. Do not open the transilluminator while the UV is on! Use signage to warn others when the UV is on. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"93AC15B064B811EA961429621D9668C5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lgjj","text":"Discard the gel into a designated biohazard bin, and clean the UV dock with 70% ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5uvul","text":"Dispose of used tips into a designated sharps container. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c3vll","text":"Dispose of gel waste into a biohazard bag.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73npp","text":"Used combs, beakers, flasks, and tray should be washed with warm water and placed on a rack to dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fn1ra","text":"Gloves and chemical waste should be sealed in a biohazard bag for incineration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aoec6","text":"Prepare the space by decontaminating surfaces with 10% household bleach followed by 70% ethanol. UV irradiate pipettes and racks. {"blocks":[{"key":"4d7e3","text":"Before resuspending oligos, pulse centrifuge to collect the pellet at the bottom of the tube. Add the appropriate buffer (see Materials) and vortex thoroughly. Also, 10-20 U fo enzyme is recommended to digest 1 ug of DNA in a reaction volume of 50 ul for 1 hr. So, to ensure complete digestion of 1 ug of genomic DNA, 20 U of each enzyme is used n a reaction volume of 50 ul for 4 hr. MspI is not active beyond 4 hr. Also, the enzyme volume should not exceed 10% of the total reaction volume to prevent star activity due to excess glycerol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fc3kk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8a0om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9idia","text":"This step is to remove the T4 DNA ligase, adapter dimer (ca. 90 bp) and unligated adapter (55 and 35 bp). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"38k2n","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"98i1p","text":"At this stage we \"could\" remove some of the fragments that are not of interest. A right-sided selection followed by a left-sided selection can be sued to select fragments within a certain range. Potentially a simple right-sided selection may be beneficial here because it will remove larger fragments without such a loss of yield of smaller fragments that may be of interest. Trying to remove small fragments of litte interest (e.g. \u003c100 bp) may result in a substantial loss of yield for those in the target range (180-300 bp). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4e5tm","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"61o7m","text":"For a right-sided selection, a ratio of 0.6 X beads should remove most fragments \u003e500 bp without substantial reduction in yield in the 100-300 bp size range. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4k3o8","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ev6a","text":"For a left sided-selection, a ratio of 1.6 X beads should remove most fragments \u003c100 bp without a substantial reduction in yield in the 100-300 bp size range. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"egp4r","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9aqe3","text":"BUT this would only really be beneficial if doing the amplification BEFORE size-selection. {"blocks":[{"key":"4lf5e","text":"qPCR quant the RAD library","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45teh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akb5t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvkq6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"88p0","text":"This step is to make sure the ligation worked and to see what sized fragments would amplify. This step could be performed with alongside standards of known concentration to calculate the number of libarary molecules output in the RAD library. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4l5n5","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f35o3","text":"You can also run more of a serial dilution of the library to ensure the quantitation is accurate. Here, I only input 1 ul of the neat library and 1 ul of a 1 in 20 dilution. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e47ve","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fjhk8","text":"It could be possible to amplify the RAD library with indexes and THEN perform size selection. However, I am not sure how this may bias the probe set as it has not been tested, so I follow recommendations of Suchan et al. (2016), performing the size selection BEFORE the indexing PCR/library amplification. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2alqq","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ihi9","text":"After initial testing, I routinely skip this step  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ak8pd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tbcp","text":"Depending on the total yield and concentration determined using the Qubit (see Step 3.6 above), run approximately 1 ug of DNA in 20 ul (ca. 75 ng/ul) of each samples across a lane of a PippinHT electrophoresis system (2% gel, Marker 20B), selecting fragments 272 bp in size (272 bp peak with tight range 212-332 bp--this equates to an insert size of 180 bp) and following the manufacturer's instructions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm1ec","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cih19","text":"http://www.sagescience.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/PippinHT-Operations-Manual-Rev-B_460005.pdf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":97}],"data":{}},{"key":"ai3lp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c172u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fda2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"205BFE496D5511EA93630242AC110006","url":"http://www.sagescience.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/PippinHT-Operations-Manual-Rev-B_460005.pdf"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8jham","text":"180 bp insert size / probe size was used by Suchan et al. (2016) and Schmitt et al. (2018?). It is possible to make probes smaller than this, which may be beneficial for caputuring ancient DNA, but be sure to check the restriction enzymes used will generate enough loci within this size range. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Inserts of 50 bp will be 162 bp. If there are many fragments outside the target range (180 bp insert, i.e., 272 bp with adapters or say 250-300 bp), then definitely size select BEFORE  indexing/amplification. If most amplified fragments are within the desired size range, it MAY be possible to size select after indexing/library amplification, but I have not tested this, and do not know whether it would bias the probe set in a different way. It is possible that size selecting after indexing/library amplification would deplete the yield so much as to require more amplification anyway. If you aren't interested in knowing which probes came from which extract, then all reactions may be amplified with the same indexing primers. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bptc7","text":"I have typically performed the indexing / library amplification in quadruplicate reactions, using 5 ul of library per reaction (using the up whole library). You can input less DNA into each reaction and perform more replicates if you desire more DNA at the end. This will mean you have more clonal probes, but that is not too much of an issue here because we do want several copies of each probe. You can also perform more cycles, though having little DNA and increasing the number of cycles can generate amplification artefacts. Typically I will perform 30 cycles, just enough to take the reaction to plateau. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":34,"offset":106,"style":"bold"}],"key":"clnmj","text":"Remember that each library will have it's own unique combination of forward and reverse indexing primers. Do not add these to the master mix, but add each to each reaction individually! Take great care not to cross-contaminate primers: only have one tube open at a time. Use qPCR tubes with individual capped lids (not strip lids!).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ekclq","text":"Ideally, indexing combinations should never be reused in the lab. Be sure to follow Illumina's recommendations when chosing primer combinations (e.g., ensure adequate diversity in the bases, ensure each is at least 3 bp different from each other, don't use indexes that will begin with two dark cycles, etc.). For instance, the NextSeq cannot read \"GG\" a the start of an index (so indexes should not end in \"CC\" as they are sequenced in the reverse complement). {"blocks":[{"key":"8jeo6","text":"Set a heat block to 95 deg C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dh9e7","text":"Pellet the MyOne C1 Streptavidin beads for 2 min with the magnetic rack. Discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"378en","text":"Set a water bath or thermalshaker to 55 deg C. Warm Wash buffer 2.2 to 55 deg C for 45 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"der5j","text":"Add 200 ul * # reactions of Binding buffer to the beads. Vortex and pulse centrifuge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3a6v","text":"Pellet the beads with the magnetic rack and discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"10hv","text":"Repeat Step 34-35 two more times for a total of 3 washes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"43pfd","text":"Resuspend the beads in 70 ul * # reactions of Binding buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6skj4","text":"Aliquot 70 ul of beads into a 1.5 ml Lo-bind Eppendorf tube (1 per reaction).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c4a6","text":"Warm the bead aliquots to 55 deg C in the thermoshaker/water bath for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4akm0","text":"Transfer the hybridised libraries at 60 deg C to the bead aliquots. Pipette to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1t2h","text":"Incubate the hybridised libraries and beads in the thermoshaker/waterbath for 30 min at 55 deg C. Agitate every 5 minutes by flicking or gently continuously shake. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12t2u","text":"Pulse centrifuge. Pellet the beads with the magnetic rack. Discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38n9a","text":"Add 500 ul heated Wash Buffer 2.2 to the beads. Vortex and pulse centrifuge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63uu9","text":"Incubate 10 min at 55 deg C in the thermoshaker/water bath. Agitate every 2 min by flicking. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5r20d","text":"Pulse centrifuge. Pellet the beads with the magnetic rack. Discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0dc9","text":"Repeat the wash steps above (Steps 43-45) two more times for a total of 3 washes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djvlj","text":"Add 30 ul of 10 mM Tris-HCl/0.05% Tween-20 to the washed beads. Resuspend by pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ek463","text":"Incubate at 95 deg C in a heat block for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9c32j","text":"Pellet the beads with a magnetic rack and transfer the supernatant to a clean 1.5 ml tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ibff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vlnu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51uqq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"340q9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3un5","text":"At this point you can treat with RNAseA to remove any RNA or put RNAse A in the PCR but it is not necessary as the RNA will not amplify. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dl4qa","text":"Add 22.5 ul of master mix to each PCR tube following the schematic below. Pulse centrifuge the tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o2vg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iokn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6r4mk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":""},"colWidths":[50,50],"data":[["Capture001 Neat",null],["Capture001 1in10",null],["Capture002 Neat",null],["Capture002 1in10",null],["Capture003 Neat",null],["Capture003 1in10",null],["PCR NTC",null],["PCR NTC",null]],"guid":"F3770F60708C11EAB8F7EF3B9D672908","legend":"","mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"73tjd","text":"Label tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asbnq","text":"Dilute the captured libraries 1 in 10 in Ultrapure water (i.e., 1 ul in 9 ul Ultrapure water). Vortex and pulse centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clp6o","text":"Add 20 ul of master mix to each PCR tube following the schematic below. Pulse centrifuge the tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cq2u3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej5vj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"el2fp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebscj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bn97","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":""},"colWidths":[50,50],"data":[["Capture001 Neat","Capture003 Neat"],["Capture001 Neat","Capture003 Neat"],["Capture001 Neat","Capture003 Neat"],["Capture001 Neat","Capture003 Neat"],["Capture002 Neat",null],["Capture002 Neat",null],["Capture002 Neat",null],["Capture002 Neat",null]],"guid":"791F75D9708D11EAA4E30242AC110002","legend":"","mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a20jn","text":"Pulse centrifuge the 8-well qPCR strip tubes containing the master mix. Bring to the post-PCR space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19p3c","text":"To the end-point PCR, add 2.5 ul of both neat and 1in10 captured library to the corresponding tubes. Add 2.5 ul nuclease free water to the remaining wells as PCR no-template controls. Vortex and pulse centrifuge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7141v","text":"Place tubes in the thermal cycler and run the following PCR program:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fscig","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3atf9","text":"    95 deg C for 10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39tef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"decd0","text":"    Followed by 50 cycles of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rnj6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f2bp","text":"    95 deg C for 30 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esj10","text":"    60 deg C for 30 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lq7l","text":"    72 deg C for 30 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41p5a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6al5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9j7h1","text":"When the PCR is finished, determine the optimal number of cycles to give in the final PCR to ensure libraries are not over-amplified. i.e., stop the PCR during the linear phase of amplification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae91h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e150u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6qts5","text":"This is particularly important if you performed a capture that contained a pool of samples, and why if you DO capture a pool you ensure that both forward and reverse indexes are unique (not just the combination)--over-amplification can cause tag-jumping, so if the indexes are completely unique to a sample, even if tag jumping occurs they will be thrown out becuase the erroneous combination can be identified. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"105ts","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b0ipa","text":"This step could be performed with alongside standards of known concentration to calculate the number of library molecules output from the capture library. This could be compared to to the number of library molecules input into the capture--if the capture worked, you would expect much fewer molecules OUT of the capture than went in. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"36u8j","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b4mea","text":"The Neat and 1in10 dilution of libraries should show be approximately 3.33 cycles apart. If they are not, there might be too much input DNA in the qPCR. Dilute futher and run the qPCR to get a more accurate estimate of library molecules. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8vvc5","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"elogc","text":"To the second PCR add 5 ul of the neat library (as long as amplification was NOT inhibited in the first PCR; if amplification efficiency was poor, amplify a dilution and do more replicates). Perform enough replicates to amplify the entire captured library.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f70b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52u43","text":"Based on the average fragment length and Qubit measurement, calculate the molarity of the library dilutions. Create a standard curve to check that the concentrations are linear. If they can be \"trusted\", extrapolate the neat concentration based on the dilutions. Average all the measurements of the neat concentration to get the best estimate of the library molarity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"buna3","text":"Dilute the library to between 2-4 nM in Ultrapure water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cc1de","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2va01","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"44mcd","text":"Note that if your libraries were built using the single-stranded protocol (Gansauge and Meyer 2013; Gansauge et al. 2017),  you will need CL72_custom_sequencing_primer to sequence. This can be spiked into well 12 (but select 'no custom primer' in the run set up) or into well 18 (select 'custom primer' in the run set up). Spiking the custom primers into the run is preferable so that the remaining Illumina primers are present and can sequence PhiX. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a240o","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":244,"style":"bold"}],"key":"fk1pp","text":"You do not need custom i5_indexing_primer to sequence off a MiSeq or NovaSeq because these instruments prime off P5. You do not need a custom i7 indexing primer because it uses primers already included in the kit. Note that for the NextSeq you will need custom i5_indexing_primer in addition to the CL72_custom_sequencing_primer. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l3g","text":"Follow the manufacturer's instructions to perform the sequencnig run on your Illumina platform of choice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ev512","text":"Prepare the space by decontaminating surfaces with 10% household bleach followed by 70% ethanol. UV irradiate pipettes and racks. {"blocks":[{"key":"ed0eq","text":"Transfer the mixture to a MinElute Silica Spin Column (purple) placed inside a collection tube. Centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm in a bench-top centrifuge. {"blocks":[{"key":"26tig","text":"Add 700 ul of PE Buffer to the column. Centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm in a bench-top centrifuge. Discard the flow-through. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9g7q6","text":"Repeat Step 29.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7r978","text":"Add 25 ul of EB buffer to the column. Incubate 5 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0qb6","text":"Centrifuge 1 min at 13,000 rpm. Add the eluate back through the column to increase yield. Incubate for 5 min at room temperature. Centrifuge 1 min at 13,000 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dgr7f","text":"Transfer the eluate to a clean 0.5 ml Lo-bind tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
